page.title: 18THE WORK OF A MAGISTRATE
page.content: A magistrate is a person given the authority to judge the public-he is often called a Justice of the Peace . Decisions must be reached within the law .The case must be based on the evidence brought to his notice.They trains for about 3 months solid at the start but that is not all for they are learning new things the time.Being a magistrate is hard work if it is done properly.It involves time and patience to listen to what the defend- ants say.Male J.Ps wear dark suits and ties and white shirts.Females wear dark dresses or suits of decent length.Court starts at 10 a.m. whilst the finishing time is variable.It all depends on the amount and length of cases.There is a wide variety of cases, mostly motoring offences and smaller crimes.J.Ps.do not deal with serious cases like murder.
